__inputs.description: Time range for computing rps graphs with rate(). At the very minimum it should be two times the scrape interval.
__inputs.label: Rate time range
__inputs.name: PROMETHEUS_RATE_TIME_RANGE

description: Dashboard for Tarantool Data Grid ver. 2 application monitoring, based on grafonnet library.

panels.description:
Overview of Tarantool instances observed by Prometheus job.

If instance row is *red*, it means Prometheus can't reach
URI specified in targets or ran into error.
If instance row is *green*, it means instance is up and running and
Prometheus is successfully extracting metrics from it.
"Uptime" column shows time since instant start.

targets.expr:
up{job=~"$job"} * on(instance) group_left(alias) tnt_info_uptime{job=~"$job"} or
on(instance) label_replace(up{job=~"$job"}, "alias", "Not available", "instance", ".*")

panels.title: Cluster status overview

panels.description:
Count of running Tarantool instances observed by Prometheus job.
If Prometheus can't reach URI specified in targets
or ran into error, instance is not counted.

Overall value of memory used by Tarantool
items and indexes (*arena_used* value).
If Tarantool instance is not available
for Prometheus metrics extraction now,
its contribution is not counted.

Overall value of memory available for Tarantool items
and indexes allocation (*memtx_memory* or *quota_size* values).
If Tarantool instance is not available for Prometheus metrics
extraction now, its contribution is not counted.

Overall rate of HTTP requests processed
on Tarantool instances (all methods and response codes).
If Tarantool instance is not available for Prometheus metrics
extraction now, its contribution is not counted.


If `No data` displayed, check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.

Overall rate of network requests processed on Tarantool instances.
If Tarantool instance is not available for Prometheus metrics
extraction now, its contribution is not counted.


If `No data` displayed, check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.

Overall rate of operations performed on Tarantool spaces
(*select*, *insert*, *update* etc.).
If Tarantool instance is not available for Prometheus metrics
extraction now, its contribution is not counted.


If `No data` displayed, check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.

Number of "warning" issues on each cluster instance.
"warning" issues includes high replication lag, replication long idle,
failover and switchover issues, clock issues, memory fragmentation,
configuration issues and alien members warnings.

Panel works with `cartridge >= 2.0.2`, `metrics >= 0.6.0`,
while `metrics >= 0.9.0` is recommended for per instance display.
panels.title: Cartridge warning issues

panels.description:
Number of "critical" issues on each cluster instance.
"critical" issues includes replication process critical fails and
running out of available memory.

Panel works with `cartridge >= 2.0.2`, `metrics >= 0.6.0`,
while `metrics >= 0.9.0` is recommended for per instance display.
panels.title: Cartridge critical issues

panels.description:
`follows` status means replication is running.
Otherwise, `not running` is displayed.

Panel works with `metrics >= 0.13.0` and Grafana 8.x.
panels.title: Tarantool replication status

panels.description:
`master` status means instance is available for read and
write operations. `slave` status means instance is
available only for read operations.

Panel works with `metrics >= 0.11.0` and Grafana 8.x.
panels.title: Tarantool instance status

panels.description:
Replication lag value for Tarantool instance.

Panel works with `metrics >= 0.13.0`.
panels.title: Tarantool replication lag

panels.description:
Clock drift across the cluster.
max shows difference with the fastest clock (always positive),
min shows difference with the slowest clock (always negative).

Panel works with `metrics >= 0.10.0`.
panels.title: Instances clock delta

panels.description: Memory used for network input/output buffers.
panels.title: Net memory

panels.description:
Data received by instance from binary protocol connections.
Graph shows average bytes per second.


If `No data` displayed, check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.
panels.title: Data received

panels.description:
Data sent by instance with binary protocol connections.
Graph shows average bytes per second.


If `No data` displayed, check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.
panels.title: Data sent

panels.description:
Number of network requests this instance has handled.
Graph shows mean rps.

Panel will be removed in favor of "Processed requests"
and "Requests in queue (overall)" panels.


If `No data` displayed, check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.
panels.title: Network requests handled

panels.description:
Number of pending network requests.

Panel will be removed in favor of "Requests in progress"
and "Requests in queue (current)" panels.
panels.title: Network requests pending

panels.description:
Average number of requests processed by tx thread per second.

Panel works with `metrics >= 0.13.0` and `Tarantool >= 2.10-beta2`.
panels.title: Processed requests

panels.description:
Number of requests currently being processed in the tx thread.

Panel works with `metrics >= 0.13.0` and `Tarantool >= 2.10-beta2`.
panels.title: Requests in progress

panels.description:
Average number of requests which was placed in queues
of streams per second.

Panel works with `metrics >= 0.13.0` and `Tarantool >= 2.10-beta2`.
panels.title: Requests in queue (overall)

panels.description:
Number of requests currently waiting in queues of streams.

Panel works with `metrics >= 0.13.0` and `Tarantool >= 2.10-beta2`.
panels.title: Requests in queue (current)

panels.description: Average number of new binary protocol connections per second.
panels.title: New binary connections

panels.description: Number of current active binary protocol connections.
panels.title: Current binary connections

panels.content:
`quota_used_ratio` > 90%, `arena_used_ratio` > 90%, 50% < `items_used_ratio` < 90% – your memory is highly fragmented. See [docs](https://www.tarantool.io/en/doc/1.10/reference/reference_lua/box_slab/#lua-function.box.slab.info) for more info.

`quota_used_ratio` > 90%, `arena_used_ratio` > 90%, `items_used_ratio` > 90% – you are running out of memory. You should consider increasing Tarantool’s memory limit (*box.cfg.memtx_memory*).
panels.title: Slab allocator monitoring information

panels.description:
`quota_used_ratio` = `quota_used` / `quota_size`.

`quota_used` – used by slab allocator (for both tuple and index slabs).

`quota_size` – memory limit for slab allocator (as configured in the *memtx_memory* parameter).
panels.title: Used by slab allocator (quota_used_ratio)

panels.description:
`arena_used_ratio` = `arena_used` / `arena_size`.

`arena_used` – used for both tuples and indexes.

`arena_size` – allocated for both tuples and indexes.
panels.title: Used for tuples and indexes (arena_used_ratio)

panels.description:
`items_used_ratio` = `items_used` / `items_size`.

`items_used` – used only for tuples.

`items_size` – allocated only for tuples.
panels.title: Used for tuples (items_used_ratio)

panels.description: Memory used by slab allocator (for both tuple and index slabs).
panels.title: Used by slab allocator (quota_used)

panels.description: Memory used for both tuples and indexes.
panels.title: Used for tuples and indexes (arena_used)

panels.description: Memory used for only tuples.
panels.title: Used for tuples (items_used)

panels.description: Memory limit for slab allocator (as configured in the *memtx_memory* parameter).
panels.title: Slab allocator memory limit (quota_size)

panels.description: Memory allocated for both tuples and indexes by slab allocator.
panels.title: Allocated for tuples and indexes (arena_size)

panels.description: Memory allocated for only tuples by slab allocator.
panels.title: Allocated for tuples (items_size)

panels.description:
Number of records in the space (memtx engine).
Name of space is specified after dash.
panels.title: Number of records (memtx)

panels.description:
Number of records in the space (vinyl engine).
Name of space is specified after dash.
By default this metrics is disabled,
to enable it you must set global variable
include_vinyl_count to true. Beware that
count() operation scans the space and may
slow down your app. 

Panel works with `metrics >= 0.13.0`.
panels.title: Number of records (vinyl)

panels.description:
Total number of bytes in all tuples of the space (memtx engine).
Name of space is specified after dash.
panels.title: Data size (memtx)

panels.description:
Total number of bytes taken by the index.
Name of space is specified after dash,
index name specified in parentheses.
Includes both memtx and vinyl spaces.
panels.title: Index size

panels.description:
Total size of tuples and all indexes in the space (memtx engine).
Name of space is specified after dash.
panels.title: Total size (memtx)

panels.description:
The amount of data stored in the `.run` files located in the `vinyl_dir` directory.

Panel works with `metrics >= 0.8.0`.
panels.title: Vinyl disk data

panels.description:
The amount of data stored in the `.index` files located in the `vinyl_dir` directory.

Panel works with `metrics >= 0.8.0`.
panels.title: Vinyl disk index

panels.description:
Amount of memory in bytes currently used to store indexes.
If the metric value is close to box.cfg.vinyl_memory, this
indicates that vinyl_page_size was chosen incorrectly.
panels.title: Index memory

panels.description: Amount of memory in bytes used by bloom filters.
panels.title: Bloom filter memory

panels.description:
The estimated average rate of taking dumps, bytes per second.
Initially, the rate value is 10 megabytes per second
and being recalculated depending on the the actual rate.
Only significant dumps that are larger than one megabyte
are used for the estimate.

Panel works with `metrics >= 0.8.0`.
panels.title: Vinyl regulator dump bandwidth

panels.description:
The actual average rate of performing the write operations, bytes per second.
The rate is calculated as a 5-second moving average.
If the metric value is gradually going down, this can indicate some disk issues.

Panel works with `metrics >= 0.8.0`.
panels.title: Vinyl regulator write rate

panels.description:
The write rate limit, bytes per second.
The regulator imposes the limit on transactions based on the observed dump/compaction performance.
If the metric value is down to approximately 100 Kbps,
this indicates issues with the disk or the scheduler.

Panel works with `metrics >= 0.8.0`.
panels.title: Vinyl regulator rate limit

panels.description:
The maximum amount of memory used for in-memory storing of a vinyl LSM tree.
When accessing this maximum, the dumping must occur.
For details, see https://www.tarantool.io/en/doc/latest/book/box/engines/#engines-algorithm-filling-lsm.
The value is slightly smaller than the amount of memory allocated for vinyl trees,
which is the `vinyl_memory` parameter.

Panel works with `metrics >= 0.8.0`.
panels.title: Vinyl regulator dump watermark

panels.description:
The number of fibers that are blocked waiting for Vinyl level0 memory quota.

Panel works with `metrics >= 0.13.0` and `Tarantool >= 2.8.3`.
panels.title: Vinyl regulator blocked writers

panels.description:
Average per second rate of commits (successful transaction ends).
It includes implicit commits: for example, any insert operation causes a commit
unless it is within a `box.begin()`–`box.commit()` block.

Panel works with `metrics >= 0.8.0`.


If `No data` displayed, check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.
panels.title: Vinyl tx commit rate

panels.description:
Average per second rate of rollbacks (unsuccessful transaction ends).
This is not merely a count of explicit `box.rollback()` requests — it includes requests
that ended with errors.
Panel works with `metrics >= 0.8.0`.


If `No data` displayed, check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.
panels.title: Vinyl tx rollback rate

panels.description:
Average per second rate of conflicts that caused transactions to roll back.
The ratio `tx conflicts` / `tx commits` above 5% indicates that vinyl is not healthy.
At this moment you’ll probably see a lot of other problems with vinyl.

Panel works with `metrics >= 0.8.0`.


If `No data` displayed, check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.
panels.title: Vinyl tx conflict rate

panels.description:
Number of current read views, that is, transactions entered a read-only state
to avoid conflict temporarily.
If the value stays non-zero for a long time, it indicates of a memory leak.

Panel works with `metrics >= 0.8.0`.
panels.title: Vinyl read views

panels.description:
The number of the scheduler dump/compaction tasks in progress now.

Panel works with `metrics >= 0.8.0`.
panels.title: Vinyl scheduler tasks in progress

panels.description:
Scheduler dump/compaction tasks failed.
Average per second rate is shown.

Panel works with `metrics >= 0.8.0`.


If `No data` displayed, check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.
panels.title: Vinyl scheduler failed tasks rate

panels.description:
Time spent by all worker threads performing dumps.
Average per second rate is shown.

Panel works with `metrics >= 0.8.0`.


If `No data` displayed, check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.
panels.title: Vinyl scheduler dump time rate

panels.description:
Scheduler dumps completed average per second rate.

Panel works with `metrics >= 0.13.0`.


If `No data` displayed, check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.
panels.title: Vinyl scheduler dump count rate

panels.description:
This is the average share of time
spent by instance process executing in user mode.
Metrics obtained using `getrusage()` call.

Panel works with `metrics >= 0.8.0`.


If `No data` displayed, check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.
panels.title: CPU user time

panels.description:
This is the average share of time
spent by instance process executing in kernel mode.
Metrics obtained using `getrusage()` call.

Panel works with `metrics >= 0.8.0`.


If `No data` displayed, check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.
panels.title: CPU system time

panels.description:
Amount of time that each process has been scheduled
in user mode, measured in clock ticks (divide by
sysconf(_SC_CLK_TCK)).  This includes guest time,
guest_time (time spent running a virtual CPU, see
below), so that applications that are not aware of
the guest time field do not lose that time from
their calculations. Average ticks per second is displayed.

Metrics are obtained by parsing `/proc/self/task/[pid]/stat`.
panels.title: Thread user time

panels.description:
Amount of time that this process has been scheduled
in kernel mode, measured in clock ticks (divide by
sysconf(_SC_CLK_TCK)). Average ticks per second is displayed.

Metrics are obtained by parsing `/proc/self/task/[pid]/stat`.
panels.title: Thread system time

panels.description:
Memory used for the Lua runtime.
Lua memory is bounded by 2 GB per instance.
panels.title: Lua runtime memory

panels.description:
Memory in use by active transactions.
For the vinyl storage engine, this is the total size of
all allocated objects (struct txv, struct vy_tx, struct vy_read_interval)
and tuples pinned for those objects.
panels.title: Transactions memory

panels.description:
Average rate of fiber context switches.
Context switches are counted over all current fibers.


If `No data` displayed, check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.
panels.title: Fiber context switches

panels.description:
Duration of last event loop iteration (tx thread).
High duration results in longer responses,
possible bad health signals and may be the
reason of "Too long WAL write" errors.

Panel works with `metrics >= 0.13.0`.
panels.title: Event loop time

panels.description:
Current number of fibers in tx thread. 

Panel works with `metrics >= 0.13.0`.
panels.title: Number of fibers

panels.description: Amount of memory used by current fibers.
panels.title: Memory used by fibers

panels.description: Amount of memory reserved for current fibers.
panels.title: Memory reserved for fibers

panels.description:
Average number of snap restores (guard assertions
leading to stopping trace executions) per second.


Panel works with `metrics >= 0.6.0` and `Tarantool >= 2.6`.

If `No data` displayed, check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.
panels.title: Snap restores

panels.description:
Average number of new JIT traces per second.


Panel works with `metrics >= 0.6.0` and `Tarantool >= 2.6`.

If `No data` displayed, check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.
panels.title: JIT traces written

panels.description:
Average number of JIT trace aborts per second.


Panel works with `metrics >= 0.6.0` and `Tarantool >= 2.6`.

If `No data` displayed, check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.
panels.title: JIT traces aborted

panels.description:
Total size of allocated machine code areas.


Panel works with `metrics >= 0.6.0` and `Tarantool >= 2.6`.
panels.title: Machine code areas

panels.description:
Average number of strings being extracted from hash instead of allocating per second.


Panel works with `metrics >= 0.6.0` and `Tarantool >= 2.6`.

If `No data` displayed, check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.
panels.title: Strings interned

panels.description:
Average number of strings being allocated due to hash miss per second.


Panel works with `metrics >= 0.6.0` and `Tarantool >= 2.6`.

If `No data` displayed, check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.
panels.title: Strings allocated

panels.description:
Average count of incremental GC steps (atomic state) per second.


Panel works with `metrics >= 0.6.0` and `Tarantool >= 2.6`.

If `No data` displayed, check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.
panels.title: GC steps (atomic)

panels.description:
Average count of incremental GC steps (sweepstring state) per second.


Panel works with `metrics >= 0.6.0` and `Tarantool >= 2.6`.

If `No data` displayed, check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.
panels.title: GC steps (sweepstring)

panels.description:
Average count of incremental GC steps (finalize state) per second.


Panel works with `metrics >= 0.6.0` and `Tarantool >= 2.6`.

If `No data` displayed, check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.
panels.title: GC steps (finalize)

panels.description:
Average count of incremental GC steps (sweep state) per second.


Panel works with `metrics >= 0.6.0` and `Tarantool >= 2.6`.

If `No data` displayed, check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.
panels.title: GC steps (sweep)

panels.description:
Average count of incremental GC steps (propagate state) per second.


Panel works with `metrics >= 0.6.0` and `Tarantool >= 2.6`.

If `No data` displayed, check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.
panels.title: GC steps (propagate)

panels.description:
Average count of incremental GC steps (pause state) per second.


Panel works with `metrics >= 0.6.0` and `Tarantool >= 2.6`.

If `No data` displayed, check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.
panels.title: GC steps (pause)

panels.description:
Number of allocated string objects.


Panel works with `metrics >= 0.6.0` and `Tarantool >= 2.6`.
panels.title: String objects allocated

panels.description:
Number of allocated table objects.


Panel works with `metrics >= 0.6.0` and `Tarantool >= 2.6`.
panels.title: Table objects allocated

panels.description:
Number of allocated cdata objects.


Panel works with `metrics >= 0.6.0` and `Tarantool >= 2.6`.
panels.title: cdata objects allocated

panels.description:
Number of allocated userdata objects.


Panel works with `metrics >= 0.6.0` and `Tarantool >= 2.6`.
panels.title: userdata objects allocated

panels.description:
Current allocated Lua memory.


Panel works with `metrics >= 0.6.0` and `Tarantool >= 2.6`.
panels.title: Current Lua memory

panels.description:
Average amount of freed Lua memory per second.


Panel works with `metrics >= 0.6.0` and `Tarantool >= 2.6`.
panels.title: Freed Lua memory

panels.description:
Average amount of allocated Lua memory per second.


Panel works with `metrics >= 0.6.0` and `Tarantool >= 2.6`.
panels.title: Allocated Lua memory

panels.description:
Total count of SELECT requests to all instance spaces.

If `No data` displayed, check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.

Calls to evaluate Lua code.

Requests resulted in error.

panels.description:
Authentication requests.
Graph shows average requests per second.


If `No data` displayed, check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.
panels.title: Authentication requests

panels.description:
SQL prepare calls.
Graph shows average calls per second.

Panel works with Tarantool 2.x.


If `No data` displayed, check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.

SQL execute calls.

panels.description:
Number of ops (callbacks, events, etc) waiting in queue
for application to serve with rd_kafka_poll().
panels.title: Operations in queue

panels.description: Current number of messages in producer queues.
panels.title: Messages in queue

panels.description: Current number of messages in producer queues.
panels.title: Size of messages in queue

panels.description:
Number of requests sent to Kafka brokers.
Graph shows mean requests per second.


If `No data` displayed, check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.
panels.title: Requests sent

panels.description:
Amount of bytes transmitted to Kafka brokers.
Graph shows mean bytes per second.


If `No data` displayed, check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.

panels.description:
Number of responses received from Kafka brokers.
Graph shows mean responses per second.


If `No data` displayed, check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.

panels.description:
Amount of bytes received from Kafka brokers.
Graph shows mean bytes per second.


If `No data` displayed, check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.

panels.description:
Number of messages transmitted (produced) to Kafka brokers.
Graph shows mean messages per second.

panels.description:
Amount of message bytes (including framing) received
from Kafka brokers.
Graph shows mean bytes per second.


If `No data` displayed, check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.
panels.title: Message bytes received

panels.description: Time since last broker state change.
panels.title: Time since state change

panels.description:
Number of connection attempts to a broker, including successful and failed,

panels.description:
Number of disconnects from a broker (triggered by broker, network, load-balancer, etc.)

panels.description:
Number of broker thread poll wakeups.

panels.description: Number of requests awaiting transmission to a broker.

panels.description: Number of messages awaiting transmission to a broker.

panels.description: Number of messages in-flight to a broker awaiting response.

Number of requests sent to a broker.
Graph shows mean attempts per second.

Graph shows mean bytes per second.

panels.description:

Number of responses received from a broker.
Graph shows mean attempts per second.

If `No data` displayed, check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.

Number of errors received from a broker.

Number of mber of unmatched correlation ids in response
(typically for timed out requests).
Graph shows mean errors per second.


If `No data` displayed, check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.

panels.description: Time since last socket receive (or -1 if no sends yet for current connection).

panels.description:
Number of partial MessageSets received.
Graph shows mean retries per second.


If `No data` displayed, check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.

panels.description:
Number of requests sent, separated by type.
Graph shows mean requests per second.
